content: 3 25 cm shortie 2 lf020 tegan baby hat with topknot - copyright © julie taylor 2012 gauge/gauge 22 sts and 30 row to 10 cm 4 in stocking stitch on 4 mm us size 6 needles please take time to knit and block a gauge square that is larger than 10 cm 4 to ensure you measure accurately if you have more than 22 sts to 10 cm 4 try knitting again using bigger needles if you have less than 22 sts to 10 cm 4 try again using smaller needles if you have not knit and blocked a gauge swatch before i have a blog post showing you how https //www lovefibres com/blog/how-to-knit-a-gauge-swatch abbreviations garter stitch = every row knit stitch if knitting flat first round knit stitch second round purl stitch alternating the stitch each round if knitting in the round k = knit k2tog = knit two stitches together to make one stitch rs = right side st s = stitch es stocking stitch = right side row knit stitch wrong side row purl stitch if knit flat every round knit stitch if knitting in the round = work the instructions in the brackets by the number of times indicated numbers are given for the smallest size with numbers for larger sizes in brackets if only one number is given it applies to all sizes links to video tutorials weaving in yarn ends over garter stitch https //youtu be/sth6vm8upmg weaving in yarn ends over stocking stitch https //youtu be/7wg-8gdxaqs mattress stitch https //youtu be/jggyklr4hoy these and other tutorials are also available on my website here overview you cast on at the brim of the hat and work a short section of garter stitch on smaller needles to give a snug fit to frame the face you then continue in stocking stitch after completing the crown shaping you knit a narrow length of stocking stitch which when the hat is finished is tied in a cute little knot if you need help with anything please email me julie@lovefibres com selling items using this pattern you may make items to sell using this pattern under the following conditions items must be handknit by the person who purchased the pattern you as the maker are 100% responsible for ensuring your item is safely made following the legislation and safety standards in the country you are selling the item to it is your responsibility to pass safety information on to the buyer of your handknit items eg do not leave a baby unattended whilst wearing a baby hat 3 lf020 tegan baby
